description: In this series, we will take a look at creating functions as a way to collect logic into a reusable chunk. If you want to explore how to create and utilize functions to make your code more readable and maintainable, then join us there!
descriptionMD: In this series, we will take a look at creating functions as a way to collect logic into a reusable chunk. If you want to explore how to create and utilize functions to make your code more readable and maintainable, then join us there!
name: Abstracting with Functions
subtitle: Reusing code one piece at a time

episodes.description: In this series, we will take a look at creating functions as a way to collect logic into a reusable chunk. If you want to explore how to create and utilize functions to make your code more readable and maintainable, then join us there!
episodes.title: Overview

episodes.description: In this episode, Aubri and Ronnie discuss the purpose and place fo the MAC Address.  They show where to find it and why it's important to networking. The emphasize the importance of getting to know about the binary conversion for any professional networking based certification exam.
episodes.title: What is a Function

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Zach explore creating out first function in Python. Justin discusses the syntax as well as some edge cases to consider when creating a function. Moreover, Justin demonstrates the use of a function to collect programs into a more predictable format.
episodes.title: Creating a Function

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Zach continue expanding on simple functions that can be used to create more complex programs.
episodes.title: Functions without Arguments

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Zach expand the creation of functions by adding a single argument or parameter to the function. Additionally, Justin discusses that parameters can be positional in nature where the order dictates how the function runs.
episodes.title: Functions with a Single Positional Argument

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Zach take a look at functions with a single keyword argument which is like a named or labeled argument. Justin also explores the difference in readability and use of keyword arguments versus positional arguments.
episodes.title: Functions with a Single Keyword Argument

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Zach explore how a function usage can change when there are multiple positional argument including the importance of order.
episodes.title: Functions w/ Multiple Positional Arguments

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Zach discuss and explore the use of multiple keyword arguments in a Python function. Justin further demonstrates how keyword arguments alleviate the ordering and readability concerns that occur in functions.
episodes.title: Functions w/ Multiple Keyword Arguments

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Zach put all of the function types together to explore the use of positional and keyword arguments in more complex contexts.
episodes.title: Fuctions w/ Mixed Arguments
